acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.77mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) value of >2,010mg/kg, together with the absence of mortality (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of 3.29mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 1,453mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category C by EPA (1999), though an increase in the incidence of hepatoma formation was observed at 2,500ppm (ca.46mg/kg/day) in 78-week dietary studies in mice, reported in Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and since there wasbio-accumulation (log Kow=4.3 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 82.0-83.0degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro reverse mutation tests, in vitro chromosome aberration tests and in vivo micronucleus tests on mouse bone marrow cells (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992, 2004)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine and oxygen (but not fluorine), with the chlorine and oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Considered non-pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures since the substance is stable to heat (up to 150degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction or offspring development observed in rat 2-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Stable to heat (up to 150degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on test data from rabbit eye irritation studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992)): "Caused irritation, which resolved within 7 days."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of mild irritation (Draize score of 0.17 at 24 hours), which cleared up by 48 hours, observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992)).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: No skin sensitizing potential was found in guinea pig sensitization tests using the Buehler method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale:
No toxic symptoms or signs referable to specific target organs were reported in the available animal studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992)). 

Clinical signs and symptoms including "reduced locomotor activity," "staggering gait," "crawling," "prone position," "lateral position," "sedation," "weakness" and "emaciation" were reported. However, these symptoms probably occurred shortly before death at around acute toxic levels, and were not considered to provide evidence for the classification.
